phases.title: Web Application (MVP)
features: Monaco Editor with syntax highlighting (24+ languages)

phases.title: Bug Fixes
features: DocPanel footer alignment (pixel-perfect match with CodePanel)
Download button UX fix (removed checkmark animation)
Examples modal preview persistence and focus alignment

phases.title: Maintenance Release
features: Test coverage for edge cases (58 error handling tests)
Cross-browser test plan with mobile file upload docs
GitHub import feature flag (hidden until v2.0)
All 660+ tests passing (46 ControlBar tests + 6 skipped)

phases.title: Authentication & Database (Epic 2.1)
features: Complete password reset flow with email verification
Neon Postgres database via Vercel Marketplace
User schema with auth fields (reset tokens, GitHub ID, tier)
Resend email service with branded templates
Account linking (OAuth users can add password)
Backend coverage: ALL CI thresholds met (86.84% models, 65.41% routes)

phases.title: Tier System & Feature Flags (Epic 2.2)
features: Backend: Usage schema (user_id, daily_count, monthly_count, daily_reset, monthly_reset)
Backend: Usage tracking with incrementUsage() after each generation
Backend: Daily/monthly reset logic with lazy reset (serverless-friendly)
Frontend: Include JWT bearer token in API requests (Authorization: Bearer <token>)
Frontend: Usage warning banner (80% threshold with dynamic multipliers)
Frontend: Usage limit modal (100% threshold - blocks further usage)
Frontend: useUsageTracking hook for fetching usage data
Frontend: Error handling priority system (Usage Limit > API > Network > Validation)
3-tier system: Free (10 docs), Starter (50 docs $12), Pro (200 docs $29)
Open Core model: All 4 doc types in Free tier (adoption engine)
Deferred to Epic 2.5: Usage dashboard UI with progress bars and charts

phases.title: UX Enhancements & File Upload (Epic 2.3)
features: Drag-and-drop file upload with visual purple overlay
Clear button for code editor (reset code/filename/language)
Dynamic filename display in Monaco editor header
Mobile menu logout button for authenticated users
Page width expansion for better space utilization

phases.title: Payment Integration (Test Mode)
features: Stripe SDK integration with test mode
Subscription management (create via Checkout, cancel via webhooks)
Webhook handling (6 events: checkout completed, subscription created/updated/deleted, invoice paid/failed)
Pricing page UI (4 tiers with monthly/annual toggle)
Test mode validation with Stripe CLI
Database schema: subscriptions table, stripe_customer_id column, name fields (Migration 008)
Bidirectional name sync between app and Stripe
Customer origin tracking (app, stripe_dashboard, api, migration)
Manual E2E testing with test cards - all flows working
128 new tests: 114 email verification + 14 migration tests (100% pass)
Note: Upgrade/downgrade flows moved to Epic 2.8, custom receipts moved to Epic 2.7

phases.title: Essential Legal (Terms & Privacy)
features: Terms of Service page (TermsOfService.jsx with /terms route)
T&Cs acceptance checkbox on signup/payment forms
Minimum viable compliance for payment processing

phases.title: UI Integration & Usage Dashboard
features: Usage dashboard page/modal for proactive viewing (deferred from Epic 2.2)
Display: "X/10 docs used this month" with progress bar
Visual indicators (green â yellow â red based on usage %)
User profile menu (usage stats link, settings, logout)
Tier badges in header for authenticated users
Feature gates in UI (Pro badges on locked features)

phases.title: Production Launch (Post-LLC)
features: Replace test Stripe keys with live keys
Update webhook endpoints to production URLs
Verify Stripe business account (requires LLC EIN + bank account)
Test live checkout flow with real payment
Custom branded email receipt templates (override Stripe defaults)
Invoice PDF customization with CodeScribe AI branding
Store Stripe receipt URLs only (no PII in database)
Display Stripe-hosted receipts via API links
Deploy AFTER Georgia LLC formation (Jan 2-3) and Stripe business verification (Jan 11-13)

phases.title: Subscription Management UI
features: Stripe Customer Portal integration from Account Settings
Portal handles: Update card, view invoices, download receipts
Upgrade from Free â Starter/Pro/Team (via Pricing page)
Downgrade from Pro â Starter or Free (self-service)
Plan change preview: "New plan starts at next billing cycle"
Soft cancel: Tier remains active until period_end
Email notifications for all subscription changes
Backend: Add upgradePlan() and downgradePlan() methods to Subscription model

phases.title: Theme Refinements & Dark Mode
features: Light theme refinements: 20% opacity purple shadows on primary buttons
Light theme: Cyan accents for code elements (brand continuity)
Light theme: Simplified button system (solid, no gradients)
Dark mode: Neon Cyberpunk theme (slate-950 backgrounds, purple-400, cyan-400)
Dark mode: 30% opacity purple shadows for premium glow effect
Dark mode toggle with theme persistence (localStorage + system preference)
ThemeProvider context with Tailwind class-based switching
Mermaid diagram dark theme with brand colors
WCAG AAA contrast (all colors 7:1+ on backgrounds)
Figma guide v4.0 with refined shadow system and dark theme specs

phases.title: Advanced File Handling
features: Multi-file upload support (select multiple files at once)
File history and version tracking (30 days)
Error handling per file (don't fail entire batch)
Note: Basic drag-and-drop implemented in Phase 2 Epic 2.4

phases.title: GitHub Integration
features: GitHub OAuth app for repository access
Import files directly from GitHub (single file or multiple)
Rate limiting and API quota management
Required before Epic 4.2 (primary source for multi-file docs)

phases.title: Multi-File Project Documentation
features: Accept multiple files from GitHub, upload, or .zip
Requires Epic 3.3 (file handling) and Epic 4.1 (GitHub source)

phases.title: Layout & Workspace Flexibility
features: Natural follow-up to Epic 4.2 for improved workspace UX

phases.title: CLI Tool
features: Two modes: Cloud (default) and Local (--local flag)
Cloud mode: OAuth login flow (opens browser, saves JWT token)
Local mode: User provides own Claude API key (bypasses platform)
Local mode: No usage tracking, full privacy
File path support (single file or directory)
CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins)

phases.title: MCP Server
features: Works in Claude Desktop, Claude Code, Cursor, Zed out of the box
Two modes: Cloud (default) and Local (--local flag)
Cloud mode: OAuth/JWT authentication with platform
Local mode: User provides own Claude API key (full privacy)
Support for file paths, directories, and GitHub URLs
Shared auth system with web app and CLI
Most exciting for current AI-native developer audience

phases.title: VS Code Extension
features: Two implementation options: native extension OR MCP integration via Cline
OAuth login flow in IDE (same as web/CLI/MCP)
JWT token storage in VS Code SecretStorage
Extension settings (API key, doc type, mode selection)
Note: Cursor has native MCP support (Epic 5.2 covers Cursor)
